intro: Pultenaea adunca, commonly known as the narrow-leaf pultenaea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pea-like flowers and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with slender, often hairy stems. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and the flowers are usually bright yellow or orange, appearing in clusters. Pultenaea adunca is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to coastal and inland regions of southern Australia.
